name: nytimes
text:
The first wave of the coronavirus outbreak in the U.S. never really ended, and cases are surging again.

But this time, a different and much bigger swath of the country is feeling the effects. https://t.co/hLKgAJJ00i

name: nytimes
text: The first peak of the coronavirus outbreak in the U.S. came at the beginning of April, as 30,000 cases a day were r… https://t.co/w4iyErD8fl

name: nytimes
text:
In parts of the U.S., the coronavirus seemed a distant threat 2 months ago.

But cases have more than tripled in so… https://t.co/uDV2azAOIr

name: nytimes
text:
The shift of the U.S. outbreak means new groups are now experiencing its effects. 

In early April, the New York City area had almost half of all new cases some days. But the current surge has left few counties untouched in much of the South. https://t.co/6T6YbVdqMQ https://t.co/d0X2BK0dqi

name: nytimes
text: Among the areas currently seeing a rapid increase in cases are majority-Hispanic counties along the Southern border, Native American reservations in the Southwest, and majority-Black counties in the Southeast. https://t.co/6T6YbVdqMQ https://t.co/addP0ZbHhq

name: nytimes
text:
The rapid spread of the coronavirus in regions that had previously avoided much of its impact — Arizona, Texas, Florida — has caused some state and local governments to reverse plans to reopen. 

Explore more about the recent surge here. https://t.co/6T6YbVdqMQ

name: nytimes
text:
There have been more than 4,700 demonstrations during the recent Black Lives Matter protests, an average of 140 per day.

Estimates suggest there could have been as many as 26 million people who participated.
https://t.co/eoJjSHOGkw

name: nytimes
text:
The recent protests peaked on June 6, when half a million people turned out in nearly 550 places across the U.S. 

That was a single day in more than a month of protests that still continue. https://t.co/eoJjSHOGkw https://t.co/9oPLiVPMIL

name: nytimes
text: 4 recent polls suggest that about 15 million to 26 million people in the U.S. have participated in demonstrations o… https://t.co/d3q8uc3UGR

name: nytimes
text:
The first protests began in Minneapolis on May 26. 

Turnout has ranged from dozens to tens of thousands in about 2,500 small towns and large cities. https://t.co/eoJjSHOGkw https://t.co/T8Luv3jiow

name: nytimes
text: More than 40% of counties in the U.S. — at least 1,360 — have had a protest, and tallies by teams of crowd counters are revealing numbers of extraordinary scale. https://t.co/eoJjSHOGkw https://t.co/LMRqFfnl22

name: nytimes
text: Unlike with past Black Lives Matter protests, nearly 95% of counties that had a protest recently are majority white, and nearly three-quarters of the counties are more than 75% white. https://t.co/eoJjSHOGkw https://t.co/yM1ihAWKCq

name: nytimes
text: “It looks, for all the world, like these protests are achieving what very few do: setting in motion a period of significant, sustained, and widespread social, political change,” said Douglas McAdam, a professor at Stanford University. https://t.co/eoJjSHOGkw
